Headline: cofounder-CEO at Curated LegalTech | Building AI Tools for India‚Äôs DPDP Act | RegTech | GenAI + Law | MeitY Shortlist | IVLP Fellow I Aspen Fellow I Rockefeller Fellow
Comment: I find such narratives disturbing. They glorify the ‚Äúagainst all odds‚Äù and don‚Äôt point out how inequities affect families. Behind every such story (even on screens) is hero worship of almost the circumstances which we don‚Äôt see changing at all. Every year we see olympians lauded, their ‚Äúpoverty‚Äù glorified, their caretakers talked about and yet we don‚Äôt focus the lens on the poverty enough to change system thinking on the support sports heroes families need. Hell we don‚Äôt definitely talk about how acutely it affects the families when these heroes are begging and dying on the streets. I hope we change the lens soon because otherwise we will go through the same cycle of galvanizing government school teachers who ‚Äúgo above and beyond‚Äù while completely staying mute on the reality of inequities.

Headline: Corporate Trainer ,Coach (ICF), Career Mentor ,Bach Flower 4 Mental Wellbeing and Professional Success, Helping Women Rejoin Work, Competency Mapping , Ex RIL ,Ex Greaves , Ex UTV , Ex GSPC
Comment:
Absolutely ..so while society encourages a family where  both parents work ....The critical question remains .when both parents work ...Who gives Support to the young and budding stars ? .. who gives care to the sick , weak ,slow and aged ?

Earlier  people kept 1/3 rd of the day ( not week )  for supporting - Young children old  patents and relatives , sick  neibours and the community , society ....But with an emphasis on doing more and faster ...this support has gone down.

Headline: CEO & Co-founder, Muse Diagnostics | TAAL - AI digital stethoscope for heart & lung screening | Primary care √ó Senior care | #MedTech #AIinHealthcare
Comment: Totally relate to the need for support at home to empower the next generation to greater heights. However, a lot of households and parents are stuck, either in a resource shortage or in deep gendered inequities that has significant consequences for the next generation. Shambhavi Srivastava covers a lot of the issues behind systemic inequities at home, particularly related to raising children on Instagram @thegreatindiansexism . Our society doesn't support homes or families sufficiently. If we did, I think we would have a great potential for significant economic and athletic/sporting growth.
